page.title: 17HOPES AND FEARS - 4
page.content: Continued from previous page: be located nearby. b)That nationally there would be a breakdown in law and order.Internationally people feared that terrorism would spread. c)That there will be further starvation and famine in Africa. Clearly people in the "D Block" are very conservative,wishing to maintain what they see as a reasonable environment in which they live.Hence their hopes are largely ones which will safeguard the area and safeguard their children.They certainly are not looking for radical change in their lifestyles.The greatest fear is clearly international instability, and the threat this would pose,especially to world peace.Here we have the most radical wish - no nuclear bombs.
